channel.title: ecmascript on SoByte
channel.description: Recent content in ecmascript on SoByte

item.title: How to dynamically import ECMAScript modules
item.description: ECMAScript (aka ES2015 or ES) modules are a way to organize cohesive blocks of code in JavaScript. The ES module system has 2 parts. import module - use import { func } from '. /myModule' export module - uses export const func = () => {} An import module is a module that imports dependencies using the import syntax. 1 2 3 import { concat } from './concatModule'; concat('a', 'b'); // => 'ab' The imported module uses the export syntax to export components from itself.

item.title: ECMAScript 2022 Preview: 10 Proposals for Stage 4 in 2021
item.description: In 2021, a number of proposals entered Stage 4 of TC39. In the TC39 process, each proposal starts at Stage 0, and moving to Stage 4 means that the proposal has been signed off by the ECMAScript editors and has become a de facto standard feature. This article lists the 10 proposals that will enter Stage 4 in 2021 and will be incorporated into ECMAScript 2022. Class Fields Declares the
